titleInfo.title: Tennessee State Guard young men eating at Clarksville Armory

mods.accessCondition: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
mods.abstract: Five uniformed members of the Tennessee State Guard are seated as they eat their barbecue in the Clarksville Armory. The meal was served following the military program staged at the facility by the 2nd Regiment of the Tennessee State Guard on September 10, 1944.

The barbecue pictured was financed by members of the Guard. Two hundred and fifty people were in attendance and were served this included family and friends of the 2nd Regiment. The military program featured inspections and reviews, a riot control; demonstration, a chemical demonstration, and drills. On the reviewing stand were Brig. Gen. J.M. Dickinson, brigade commander; Col. R.A. Bailey, assistant adjutant general; Col. Millard F. Waltz, senior instructor, and Lt. H.S. Murphy, brigade adjutant.
